bibl.title: Tragic Sacrifice and Menandrian Cooking.
Theater and Society in the Classical World
bibl.author: SCODEL, Ruth

bibl.note: Laughter directed at the cook dissipates the tension associated with sacrifice in drama and enables the poet to have it both ways: he can keep a traditional theme, and give his dramatic solutions the sanction they need to be fully satisfying.
SCODEL Ruth, Tragic Sacrifice and Menandrian Cooking.
Ruth SCODEL (Ed.), Theater and Society in the Classical World (Ann Arbor, 1993) pp. 161-176.
